Metadata Integration Framework

Metadata Transformations Framework

Provide foundational event class types designed for easy extension by derivative classes, enabling consistent event handling and customisation.

Description

This package provides a suite of extensible event classes for structured JSON logging across diverse environments. It enables consistent event representation, simplifies integration, and supports customisation for specific application needs.

Dependencies

  • adaptiveio>=1.0.0

Contents

events.eventlog

class events.eventlog.Event(event_type: str, event_payload, event_description: str = '', log_location: str = '', macro_uuid: str | None = None)

Specialised JSONLog event with type and optional description.

events.jsonlog

class events.jsonlog.JSONLog(log_payload, log_location: str = '', indent_depth: int = 2, persistent_uuid: bool = False, macro_uuid: str | None = None)

Log events as JSON with a UUID, timestamp, and optional file output.

property class_type: str

Returns the name of the class as a string.

This property provides a dynamic way to identify the type of the current instance. It is especially useful for logging, debugging, or serialization tasks where knowing the class name is helpful. Subclasses automatically inherit this behavior without needing to override or redefine it.

Returns:

str: The name of the class (e.g., “PipelineEvent”, “TransformEvent”).

log()

Write the event to the specified log file.

repr_dict()

Return the event as a dictionary, recursively converting objects to dicts.
